alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Broward County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 12:52PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Broward County through 115 PM EDT... At 1252 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over West Park, or over Hollywood, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Pompano Beach, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Margate, Hallandale, Miami Gardens, Lauderhill, Weston, Coconut Creek, North Miami Beach, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Aventura and Lauderdale Lakes. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
